intro: Toxocarpus villosus var. villosus, commonly known as the hairy toxocarpus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
